alert.note: Alert for Berrien; Brooks; Cook; Lanier; Lowndes (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 15 at 8:45PM EDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1045 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of south central Georgia, including the following counties, Berrien, Brooks, Cook, Lanier and Lowndes. * WHEN...Until 1045 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Overflowing poor drainage areas. Some low-water crossings may become impassable. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 844 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen in the last 1 Hour. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Valdosta, Adel, Lakeland, Quitman, Hahira, Ray City, Moody Air Force Base, Meigs, Morven, Cecil, I-75 At Exit 29, New Lois, I-75 At Exit 22, Barretts, Allenville, Pine Valley, Greggs, Barney, Teeterville and Hansell. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
